snippet: The offer by Robin Yanhong Li, Baidu’s chairman, and Yu Gong, Qiyi’s chief executive, would value Qiyi.com at about $2.8 billion
abstract: Chinese search engine Baidu says it has received nonbinding proposal to buy its majority stake in Chinese video streaming website iQiyi.

byline.contributor: Paul Mozur contributed reporting from Hong Kong.

lead_paragraph: The offer by Robin Yanhong Li, Baidu’s chairman, and Yu Gong, Qiyi’s chief executive, would value Qiyi.com at about $2.8 billion

headline.main: Baidu Receives Offer for Stake in Online Video Platform Qiyi
headline.print_headline: Business Briefing; Baidu Receives Offer for Stake in Video Platform Qiyi
